page.title: 11SONY WAREHOUSE, THATCHAM.
page.content: All the equipment that comes to the Sony Factory in Thatcham has come from Japan where most of it is made. The items that are imported include: television sets, Hi Fi equipment, radios, "Walkmans", video cameras, video recorders and spare parts. All the equipment is stored in massive warehouses which are so big that about 3 football pitches would fit in each. When the lorries come to the Sony Factory, items are unloaded and put onto palettes which are then picked up by electrical fork lift trucks which take them to be stacked up. The factory not only stores equipment, it has offices where managers and secretaries work. When we made our visit we only saw one lot of offices and they were on both sides of a corridor with a meeting room at the end.
